page.description: The Data Series Builder is used to manage data series defined in the UX Component.

section.description: The data source type menu determines what type of data the data series will be created from. The options are:

item.name: SQL
item.description: Uses SQL data to create a data series that can be used inside a control. You will need to build a connection to the SQL data to be used.

item.name: SQL -CrossSection
item.description: Uses SQL data to create a data series that used with different controls. "Cross sectional" means the data will be plotted from multiple fields in a single record.

item.name: Static
item.description: Create a list or table of static data by typing in the options to appear in the data series.

item.name: Javascript
item.description: Creates a data series based on Javascript, making the data accessible to Javascript functions in your component.

item.name: Data source type
item.description: Specify where the data that populates the series comes from. Choices are 'SQL' or 'DBF' - a list of values from a SQL or DBF table, 'Static' - a static list of values, 'Custom' allows you to use use custom Xbasic and Javascript functions to dynamically compute the series values, 'Javascript' - allows you to specify a Javascript function that will compute the series values.). Choices include *[ui:SQL]*, *[ui:SQL-CrossSection]*, *[ui:DBF]*, *[ui:DBF-CrossSection]*, *[ui:Static]*, *[ui:Custom]*, *[ui:Javascript]*.

item.name: Arguments
item.description: Define arguments. Arguments can be bound to page, session and cookie variables. Argument values are passed into all server-side Xbasic event handlers in the component.TIP:For 'array arguments' (for use in a SQL IN clause), the argument name must start with 'array_'.

item.name: Connection string
item.description: Connection string property.

item.name: Method for defining SQL query
item.description: Method for defining SQL query property.

item.name: Table name
item.description: Table name property.

item.name: Field list
item.description: Field list property.

item.name: Filter
item.description: Specify the filter expression. The filter expression can reference values in other controls on the Dialog. To do this, define one or more arguments, and then bind the argument value to a control value. For example, to bind the argument value to the value in the CustomerId control, set the argument value to {CustomerId}. Your filter can then reference the argument.

item.name: Order
item.description: Order property.

item.name: Distinct
item.description: Specify if you want unique records only.

item.name: Record limit
item.description: Specify the maximum number of records to be retrieved in the SQL query. -1 indicates no limit.

item.name: SQL Statement
item.description: SQL Statement property.

item.name: Xbasic function name
item.description: Specify the name of the Xbasic function to call to compute the series values.

item.name: Subseries names
item.description: If your Xbasic function returns multiple data series, specify a comma delimited list of the names of each subseries. For example: sales,regionName

item.name: Javascript function
item.description: (Optional) Specify the name of a Javascript function to call before an Ajax callback is made to refresh the series. The data returned by this Javascript function will be available to the Xbasic function, which computes the series values.

item.name: Javascript function
item.description: Specify the name of the Javascript function that will calculate the series values.

item.name: Subseries names
item.description: If your Javascript function returns multiple data series, specify a comma delimited list of names of each subseries. For example: sales, regionName.
